case_vignette: A 35-year-old woman comes to the ph   ysician for the evaluation of increasing weakness and numbness of the upper extremities for 5 days. During the past 2 days,    she has h   ad urinary incontinence not related t o sneezing or laug   hing. Last summer, she had weakness and  numbness of her right lower extremity that was worse when she was outside; she regained h   er strength 3 weeks later. She has no history  of serious illness. She has had 10 male sexual partners in her lifetime and uses condoms inconsistently.    Vita  l signs are within normal limits. Examination    shows an impaired tandem gait. There is mil  d spasticity and muscle strength is decreased in both    upper ex  tremities. Deep tendon reflexes are 4+ bilaterally. The a   b dominal reflex is absent. Muscle strength in the right lower extremity is mildly decreased. Sensation to vibration and fin e touch is decreased over the upp   er extremities  .
question: Which  is the most appropriate    next step in diagnosis?

Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing increasing weakness and numbness in my upper extremities for the last 5 days, and for the past 2 days, I've had issues with urinary incontinence.
Have you had any recent infections or vaccinations?
No, I haven't had any recent infections or vaccinations.
Do you have any previous medical history of neurological disorders or any other chronic illnesses?
No, I don't have a history of serious illness.
Do you have any family history of neurological diseases?
I haven't mentioned any family history of neurological diseases.
Have you experienced any changes in vision or difficulty swallowing?
No, I haven't experienced any changes in vision or difficulty swallowing.
Has there been any pain associated with the weakness and numbness in your upper extremities?
No, there hasn't been any pain associated with the weakness and numbness in my upper extremities.
Final Diagnosis: Transverse Myelitis

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing increasing weakness and numbness in my arms, and I also have some problems controlling my urine.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
The weakness and numbness in my upper extremities have been happening for 5 days, and I've had urinary incontinence for the past 2 days.
Do you have any pain or stiffness in your neck or back?
No, I don't have any pain or stiffness in my neck or back.
Have you had any recent injuries or accidents involving your head, neck, or spine?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or accidents involving my head, neck, or spine.

No, I don't have a history of serious illness in my family.

Have you been diagnosed with any neurological or other conditions in the past?
No, I have not been diagnosed with any serious illnesses in the past.
Final Diagnosis: Cervical Spondylotic Myelopathy.
